snippet: Jeffrey P. Bezos will pay $250 million for the newspaper and some other businesses of The Washington Post Company.
abstract: Washington Post is being sold for $250 million to the founder of Amazon.com, Jeffrey P Bezos, in a deal that has shocked the industry; Donald E Graham, chairman and chief executive of The Washington Post Company, and the third generation of the Graham family to lead the newspaper, makes announcement and stresses that Bezos will purchase it in a personal capacity and not on behalf of Amazon the company.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear, Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Sarah Wheaton contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Jeffrey P. Bezos will pay $250 million for the newspaper and some other businesses of The Washington Post Company.

headline.main: Bezos, Amazon’s Founder, to Buy The Washington Post
headline.print_headline: Amazon’s Founder to Buy The Washington Post
